alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 4:04AM CST until March 05 at 8:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties. Iowa River at Marengo affecting Iowa and Benton Counties. Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall and run-off will cause several area tributary rivers to go into flood this week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iowa River at Marengo. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Extensive inundation of agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 15.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall tomorrow evening. It will then rise again to 16.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this morning.
